availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, grocery merchant. Native of Ireland. Son of Margaret Bustard. Married to Margaret Lynch Bustard in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 19, 1852. Father of Mary J. Bustard, George Bustard, Margaret Bustard, Catharine Bustard, John Bustard, Robert Bustard, and Mary Bustard. Grocery merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Member of the Board of Directors of the Jefferson Insurance Company from 1853 to 1860. Grocery merchant in Louisville in 1858. Grocery merchant in Louisville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
